<!-- Copilot instructions for DSA_Pattern_Hub -->
# Copilot instructions — DSA Pattern Hub

This file contains concise, repository-specific guidance for AI coding agents to be immediately productive.

1. Repo Big Picture
- Frontend-only React app (Vite) that renders a data-driven DSA learning platform. Key entrypoints: [src/main.jsx](src/main.jsx#L1), [src/app/routes.jsx](src/app/routes.jsx#L1).
- Knowledge base lives under `src/data/` (JSON files). Patterns are organized by category: `src/data/patterns/{category}/{pattern-slug}/index.json` and `problems.json`.

2. Build / Run / Dev workflow
- Install: `npm install` (root `package.json`).
- Dev server: `npm run dev` (Vite default; serves at http://localhost:5173).
- When modifying CSS/Tailwind config, restart dev server to pick up config changes.

3. Project conventions (important for edits)
- Content-first: new domain content must be added under `src/data/patterns/...` following the JSON schema in `README.md` and `docs/CONTENT_STANDARD.md`.
- UI components are small, focused, and reused from `src/components/` and `src/components/ui/`. Prefer using existing `CodeBlock.jsx`, `DifficultyBadge.jsx`, and `Tag.jsx` for UI consistency.
- Page layouts live in `src/layouts/` (`MainLayout.jsx`, `ReadingLayout.jsx`). Route-level pages in `src/pages/` map to the router in `src/app/routes.jsx`.

4. Patterns & examples to reference
- Sliding-window pattern folder: `src/data/patterns/array/sliding-window/` (contains `index.json`, `problems.json`, `template.cpp`). Use as canonical example when creating new pattern folders.
- Routing example: [src/app/routes.jsx](src/app/routes.jsx#L1) demonstrates how pattern pages are wired.

5. Data loading & helpers
- Dynamic content is loaded with `src/utils/loadPattern.js` and routed via slugs generated by `src/utils/slugify.js`.
- When adding new JSON entries, update any indices in `src/data/patterns/*/index.json` only if necessary — the site prefers discovery by folder structure.

6. Styling
- Tailwind config at `tailwind.config.js`. Global styles in `src/styles/` (use utility classes; prefer existing theme tokens in `theme.css`).

7. Tests & CI
- There are no unit tests present in the repo. For changes that affect routing or the data schema, validate manually by running the dev server and visiting the relevant pages (e.g., `/patterns`, `/patterns/:slug`).

8. Integration points & external dependencies
- No backend API — app reads static JSON under `src/data/` and `public/`.
- External links (e.g., LeetCode) are stored in problem JSON entries (see `src/data/patterns/*/problems.json`).

9. Coding style and pitfalls
- Keep React components functional and small. Prefer prop-driven UI; reuse components under `src/components/`.
- Avoid editing `docs/` or `public/` unless adding assets or documentation; these are authoritative.
- Respect the JSON schema in `README.md` when authoring `index.json` and `problems.json`.

10. Helpful file references
- Project README: [README.md](README.md#L1)
- Pattern data example: `src/data/patterns/array/sliding-window/index.json`
- Router: [src/app/routes.jsx](src/app/routes.jsx#L1)
- Utilities: `src/utils/loadPattern.js`, `src/utils/slugify.js`

If anything above is unclear or you want a different focus (tests, CI, or content authoring automation), tell me and I will iterate on this file.
